Thanks

All of the lessons are taught by Dallas ISD teachers, and KERA has edited and readied the lessons for airing, as well as curated some resources for students to apply what they learn in each lesson area. SHAC Meeting
What is a SHAC?
A SHAC (School Health Advisory Committee) is an advisory group of individuals who represent different segments of the community. By law, a majority of the members must be persons who are parents of students enrolled in the district and who are not employed by the district. A SHAC is made up of parents, community members, students, and school staff working together to improve the health of all students and families through coordinated school health programs.

Why do we need a School Health Advisory Committee (SHAC)?
• It's Texas law
o Department of State Health Services
• Healthy children learn better
• Healthy homes and healthy schools support healthy children

The components of a coordinated school health program include:
• Family and community involvement
• Nutrition services
• Physical education
• Health education
• Counseling, psychological & social services
• Health services
• Health promotion for school staff

Lisa Bullard, RN
S&S CISD District Nurse

I know it's July and we don't really want to think about back to school but it is right around the corner and there will be kids that do not have the supplies to have a successful year so this is where my crew and myself start our annual fundraiser to help these kids. Both POP'S PLACE restaurants in Denison and Southmayd are drop off locations starting tomorrow July 3rd until August 11th. This list is created by us talking to each school to see what are the most needed items, what kids are mostly missing at the beginning of school and what needs to be replenished during the middle of the school year. Please bring us anything on this list and as always if you need to drop off a cash donation to us we will gladly do the shopping for you. Last year was our biggest school supplies drive and with your help I hope to make this one even bigger!! Thank you for your help and your love for these children ❤💛 #Pops8thAnnualSchoolSuppliesDrive #ToolsForSchools #BecauseTheseKidsAreImportant #commUNITY

S&S Middle School in Sadler, Tx. came in third place in the National Financial Literacy Competition.

As part of the Capitol Hill Challenge, Students received a hypothetical $100,000 to invest in stocks and bonds, along with other investments.

All of the top 10 teams won an all-expense paid trip to Washington and were recognized at an Awards Reception Tuesday at the Rayburn House Office Building on Capitol Hill.

"They are incredibly bright, and they demonstrated why they did so well in this challenge and understanding out financial markets. It was incredible," said Representative John Ratcliffe (R-TX).

We are beyond proud of these students! Thank you Mr. Pruitt and Ms. Stuckey for being wonderful chaperones!
